channel.title: BBC News - England

item.title: Killamarsh deaths: Family's tribute to children found dead at house
item.description: The two children were found dead along with their mother and another child in Killamarsh, Derbyshire

item.title: Hossam Metwally: Doctor jailed for bogus exorcism rituals
item.description: Hossam Metwally, who injected his partner with powerful drugs, is sentenced to almost 15 years.

item.title: HMP Styal: My baby died due to errors in prison, says former inmate
item.description: A woman whose baby died during childbirth in HMP Styal says "more could have been done" to save her.

item.title: Lewis Bloor: Towie star 'part of Â£3m diamond scam'
item.description: Lewis Bloor is accused of being part of a group who conned people into buying "valueless" stones.

item.title: Bristol half marathon winner disqualified after running wrong race
item.description: Bristol half marathon winner Omar Ahmed was only signed up to the 10k and took a wrong turn.

item.title: Marble Arch Mound: Call for viewing platform to be removed
item.description: Opposition councillors say the artificial hill is an "international embarrassment to the city".

item.title: Jabbed schoolboy excited to be near grandparents
item.description: A 15-year-old in Essex is one of the first under-16s to receive a Covid-19 vaccine.

item.title: Joshua Sahota: Mental health unit death raises coroner fears
item.description: A man's family was unaware that an item that contributed to a his death was on a restricted list.

item.title: Sophie Fairall: Celebrity wish-list girl dies from rare cancer
item.description: The 10-year-old met TV chef Gordon Ramsay and won support from Premier League footballers.

item.title: Jonathan Taylor: Oil whistleblower summoned to Monaco
item.description: Jonathan Taylor faces questioning over bribery and corruption claims despite a failed extradition bid.

item.title: Nancy Pelosi gifts US flag to Chorley for hosting G7 summit
item.description: The Lancashire town has welcomed politicians from around the world for the G7 Speakers' Summit.

item.title: Bishop's Castle rugby club in tribute to 17-year-old
item.description: Dylan Price is believed to have been hit by a vehicle while walking along the road, police say.

item.title: Ipswich runner Millie King: 'You've got to be the best you can be'
item.description: The 16-year-old sprinter gets two England call-ups after focusing on training during the pandemic.

item.title: Baby squirrel abandoned on Cambridge patio bonds with carer
item.description: The squirrel, named Paquito, formed an unexpected friendship with his temporary carer.

item.title: Salford woman shares photographs of eczema flare-ups
item.description: Kymmene Dawson shares photographs of stages of eczema flare-ups to raise awareness of the condition.

item.title: 'Dachshund disco is a children's party for your dog'
item.description: Organisers James Morgan and Anushka Fernando want to help dogs socialise again after lockdown.

item.title: Manchester music cafe brings joy to people with dementia
item.description: People with dementia sing, play instruments and dance at the music cafe, says Manchester Camerata.

item.title: Northampton man guilty of attempted murder of stranger
item.description: Sean Shortland is convicted of attempted murder and described as "dangerous and depraved" by police.

item.title: Sex Pistols at Manchester Lesser Free Trade Hall films sell for Â£15k
item.description: The "only known footage" of two shows that inspired a generation of bands sells at auction.

item.title: Dan Jarvis: MP to step down as South Yorkshire Mayor
item.description: Mr Jarvis says it has been an "extraordinary privilege" to serve as South Yorkshire Mayor since 2018.

item.title: M25 protests: Arrests made as Insulate Britain activists block motorways
item.description: Insulate Britain activists have caused disruption at the M25 and A1(M) in Hertfordshire.

item.title: Supporters raise Â£10k for statue of superfan
item.description: David Clough, 78, who died in 2020, raised about Â£500,000 for Rochdale FC selling lottery tickets.

item.title: Four charged over anti-Semitic abuse shouted from car
item.description: It is alleged the group was part of a convoy travelling through St John's Wood.

item.title: Greater Manchester Police officer repeatedly Tasered handcuffed man
item.description: Phillip Smith admits assault after the police watchdog found "his use of Taser was gratuitous".

item.title: Carlisle stab victim named as Ryan Kirkpatrick
item.description: A man stabbed to death in Carlisle is identified as Ryan Kirkpatrick, aged 24.

item.title: Bournville park attack: Boy held after six-year-old assaulted
item.description: The girl had been out with her family at a playground when she was lured into a wood, police say.

item.title: England's men's and women's team withdrawn from Pakistan white-ball tour
item.description: England withdraw their men's and women's teams from series in Pakistan that were due to take place in October.

item.title: Premier League: Chelsea title charge looks hard to stop - Alan Shearer analysis
item.description: The Premier League title race is only just getting started, but Chelsea are seriously impressive right now, says MOTD2 pundit Alan Shearer.

item.title: New Zealand 48-42 England: Roses lose out to Silver Ferns in series opener
item.description: England lose 48-42 to world champions New Zealand in the first of their three-match series in Christchurch.

item.title: Harry Kewell: Barnet sack manager after seven winless games in charge
item.description: Struggling Barnet sack manager Harry Kewell after seven winless games in charge of the National League club.

item.title: County Championship 2021: Which of the four contenders will win the title?
item.description: Who plays who, who needs what and who's heading for the pavilion for the last time as the 2021 County Championship enters its final week.
